titles: Die Jovis 2. Junij, 1642. Whereas it doth appear to the Lords and Commons in Parliament, that the King, seduced by wicked counsell, doth intend to leavy warre against his Parliament; ...
author: England and Wales. Parliament.
notes: Title from caption and first lines of text.

It appears that the King intends to levy war, and that the crown jewels are pawned or sold at Amsterdam or elsewhere oversea. Whoever is of has been an actor in pawning .. shall be held and enemy of the state, .. -- Steele.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
keywords: Crown jewels --  Great Britain --  Early works to 1800.
Great Britain --  History --  Civil War, 1642-1649 --  Early works to 1800.
